results.title: Until you break
results.brief_description: Elliot Spencer has exceptional music video skills as well as a distinctive visual style. In this piece he explores the notions of masculinity, community dynamics and success & achievement in a dangerous sport.

results.title: Bundy into dreamland
results.creator_credit: Curtis Levy, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Part-time musicians discuss the problems of making a reasonable living with a band. In order to earn a living they must work at other, more mundane jobs, such as in a factory or a production line. They pursue their musical careers at nights.

results.title: Closet space
results.creator_credit: Colleen Farrelly, Karen Taylor and Cindigo Vision
results.brief_description: Parents with gay children share their experiences and feelings, fears and joys on discovering that their child is gay. A parents supporting parents Flag (South Australia), which aims to bring families together and break down the barriers of homophobia. An honest and open discussion piece which challenges and debates notions of heterosexism as parents and children share their personal stories.

results.title: Cliche
results.brief_description: “What fears do I have but fear itself? Am I in control? Can the nightmare journey I am on be transcended?” This sophisticated student film shows influences from avant-garde French cinema and features an exceptional original soundtrack.

group_works.title: Everything was perfect and then I went insane

results.title: Closely observed trains = Ostre sledovane vlaky
results.creator_credit: Jiri Menzel, Zdenek Oves and Barrandov Studios
results.brief_description: During the German occupation, a young man, Milos, (Vaclav Neckar) works as a trainee railway guard in a country station. He has only one thing on his mind; to lose his virginity, possibly with the wife of the station master (Libuse Havelkova). His attempts take him through the trauma of premature ejaculation, an attempted suicide and finally success with a member of the Underground Movement, before tragedy strikes. ‘Closely observed trains’ is adapted from a novel by Bohumil Hrabal. This film is one of the finest achievements of the Czech ‘New Wave’ and was the second Czech film to win an Oscar for best foreign film in 1967. The film was banned after the Soviet invasion of 1968 as ‘pornographic’. In Czech with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jiri Menzel, Zdenek Oves and Barrandov Studios

results.title: Close harmony
results.brief_description: An inspiring documentation of the work of music teacher Arlene Symons in bringing together a chorus of children from the 1979-1980 class of the Friends School in Brooklyn, New York and the senior chorus from the Council Centre for Senior Citizens, Brooklyn. Three months of separate rehearsals took place, and a pen pal program set up between the two groups. A week before the concert, the groups came together.
